paragraphs.content: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
paragraphs.contentHtml: <small>The Epistle of Paul the Apostle</small> <small>to the</small> Romans

paragraphs.content: Chapter 1
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 1

paragraphs.content: Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, called to be an apostle, separated unto the gospel of God,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, called to be an apostle, separated unto the gospel of God,

paragraphs.content: (Which he had promised afore by his prophets in the holy scriptures,)
paragraphs.contentHtml: (Which he had promised afore by his prophets in the holy scriptures,)

paragraphs.content: Concerning his Son Jesus Christ our Lord, which was made of the seed of David according to the flesh;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Concerning his Son Jesus Christ our Lord, which was made of the seed of David according to the flesh;

paragraphs.content: And declared to be the Son of God with power, according to the spirit of holiness, by the resurrection from the dead:
paragraphs.contentHtml: And declared to be the Son of God with power, according to the spirit of holiness, by the resurrection from the dead:

paragraphs.content: By whom we have received grace and apostleship, for obedience to the faith among all nations, for his name:
paragraphs.contentHtml: By whom we have received grace and apostleship, for obedience to the faith among all nations, for his name:

paragraphs.content: Among whom are ye also the called of Jesus Christ:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Among whom are ye also the called of Jesus Christ:

paragraphs.content: To all that be in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To all that be in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.

paragraphs.content: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all, that your faith is spoken of throughout the whole world.
paragraphs.contentHtml: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all, that your faith is spoken of throughout the whole world.

paragraphs.content: For God is my witness, whom I serve with my spirit in the gospel of his Son, that without ceasing I make mention of you always in my prayers;
paragraphs.contentHtml: For God is my witness, whom I serve with my spirit in the gospel of his Son, that without ceasing I make mention of you always in my prayers;

paragraphs.content: Making request, if by any means now at length I might have a prosperous journey by the will of God to come unto you.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Making request, if by any means now at length I might have a prosperous journey by the will of God to come unto you.

paragraphs.content: For I long to see you, that I may impart unto you some spiritual gift, to the end ye may be established;
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I long to see you, that I may impart unto you some spiritual gift, to the end ye may be established;

paragraphs.content: That is, that I may be comforted together with you by the mutual faith both of you and me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That is, that I may be comforted together with you by the mutual faith both of you and me.

paragraphs.content: Now I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that oftentimes I purposed to come unto you, (but was let hitherto,) that I might have some fruit among you also, even as among other Gentiles.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Now I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that oftentimes I purposed to come unto you, (but was let hitherto,) that I might have some fruit among you also, even as among other Gentiles.

paragraphs.content: I am debtor both to the Greeks, and to the Barbarians; both to the wise, and to the unwise.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I am debtor both to the Greeks, and to the Barbarians; both to the wise, and to the unwise.

paragraphs.content: So, as much as in me is, I am ready to preach the gospel to you that are at Rome also.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So, as much as in me is, I am ready to preach the gospel to you that are at Rome also.

paragraphs.content: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth; to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth; to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

paragraphs.content: For therein is the righteousness of God revealed from faith to faith: as it is written, The just shall live by faith.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For therein is the righteousness of God revealed from faith to faith: as it is written, The just shall live by faith.

paragraphs.content: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold the truth in unrighteousness;
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold the truth in unrighteousness;

paragraphs.content: Because that which may be known of God is manifest in them; for God hath shewed it unto them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Because that which may be known of God is manifest in them; for God hath shewed it unto them.

paragraphs.content: For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made, even his eternal power and Godhead; so that they are without excuse:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made, even his eternal power and Godhead; so that they are without excuse:

paragraphs.content: Because that, when they knew God, they glorified him not as God, neither were thankful; but became vain in their imaginations, and their foolish heart was darkened.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Because that, when they knew God, they glorified him not as God, neither were thankful; but became vain in their imaginations, and their foolish heart was darkened.

paragraphs.content: Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,

paragraphs.content: And changed the glory of the uncorruptible God into an image made like to corruptible man, and to birds, and fourfooted beasts, and creeping things.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And changed the glory of the uncorruptible God into an image made like to corruptible man, and to birds, and fourfooted beasts, and creeping things.

paragraphs.content: Wherefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their own hearts, to dishonour their own bodies between themselves:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their own hearts, to dishonour their own bodies between themselves:

paragraphs.content: Who changed the truth of God into a lie, and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator, who is blessed for ever. Amen.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who changed the truth of God into a lie, and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator, who is blessed for ever. Amen.

paragraphs.content: For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections: for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections: for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature:

paragraphs.content: And likewise also the men, leaving the natural use of the woman, burned in their lust one toward another; men with men working that which is unseemly, and receiving in themselves that recompence of their error which was meet.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And likewise also the men, leaving the natural use of the woman, burned in their lust one toward another; men with men working that which is unseemly, and receiving in themselves that recompence of their error which was meet.

paragraphs.content: And even as they did not like to retain God in their knowledge, God gave them over to a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not convenient;
paragraphs.contentHtml: And even as they did not like to retain God in their knowledge, God gave them over to a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not convenient;

paragraphs.content: Being filled with all unrighteousness, fornication, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, debate, deceit, malignity; whisperers,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Being filled with all unrighteousness, fornication, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, debate, deceit, malignity; whisperers,

paragraphs.content: Backbiters, haters of God, despiteful, proud, boasters, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Backbiters, haters of God, despiteful, proud, boasters, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,

paragraphs.content: Without understanding, covenantbreakers, without natural affection, implacable, unmerciful:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Without understanding, covenantbreakers, without natural affection, implacable, unmerciful:

paragraphs.content: Who knowing the judgment of God, that they which commit such things are worthy of death, not only do the same, but have pleasure in them that do them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who knowing the judgment of God, that they which commit such things are worthy of death, not only do the same, but have pleasure in them that do them.
